Description: Two joining fragments of oval, tapering, handle from neck join to sharpish turn, of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine red-brown. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '384'. Name Anaxiboulos. Probably from the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0048.06.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (23)
